NeuralSpike is a company distinguished by its substantial expertise in the development of artificial intelligence (AI) technology. Our founders possess a comprehensive background in the creation of AI software, demonstrating proficiency across the entire AI workflow, which includes data acquisition, annotation, model training, deployment, and monitoring.
What sets us apart is our adeptness in deploying AI solutions across diverse platforms, including edge devices, native applications, and web interfaces. This extensive capability positions us to effectively tackle a wide array of technological challenges, ensuring the delivery of innovative and tailored solutions.
Beyond technical prowess, NeuralSpike excels in team leadership, people management, and client communication. We pride ourselves on our ability to seamlessly adapt our expertise to your unique project requirements. This commitment guarantees the development and implementation of AI solutions that not only meet but exceed your specific needs and goals.
Partnering with NeuralSpike means entrusting your AI initiatives to a team that blends technical excellence with a client-centric approach. We look forward to the opportunity to collaborate and bring transformative AI solutions to your business.

title: NeuralSpike

content:
I am a co-founder and senior ML engineer at NeuralSpike. I specialize in solving various computer vision problems such as recognition, detection, and segmentation. I have played a key role in building a complete machine learning pipeline including data acquisition, model training, model maintenance, and model deployment. I have experience in model deployement on embedded devices, also for real-time applications.
I was a Post-doc at INRIA ( STARS). My research focused on: action recognition, action detection, codebook representation, multimodal representation (RGB + Depth), spatio-temporal attention, deep learning.
My PhD thesis was supervised by Francois Bremond, the thesis was a part of Toyota Partner Robot project. In this project, we focused on assessing people’s cognitive and behavioral status, based on daily-living activities monitoring.
During my PhD I was a research intern at Disney Research Pittsburgh, I worked on codebook representations for People Re-Identification.
summary: I am a co-founder and senior ML engineer at NeuralSpike. I specialize in solving various computer vision problems such as recognition, detection, and segmentation. I have played a key role in building a complete machine learning pipeline including data acquisition, model training, model maintenance, and model deployment.
title: Michal Koperski

content:
With over 10 years of work experience in AI, machine learning, and image analysis, I am a passionate and innovative AI specialist and co-founder of NeuralSpike, a company that develops custom AI solutions for various domains and industries and Hetalox, a medtech startup that provides artificial intelligence solutions for advanced assessment and analysis of brain MRI studies.
I have a PhD in Computer Science from Heidelberg University, and multiple certifications in statistical learning, deep learning, and AI applications. My mission is to leverage my expertise and creativity to solve complex and impactful problems with AI, and to contribute to the advancement of the field through research and collaboration.
At NeuralSpike, I lead and manage the technical aspects of the AI projects, from ideation to deployment, working closely with clients and partners to understand their needs and expectations, and to deliver high-quality and scalable solutions. I also oversee the research and development of new AI algorithms and techniques, and publish the results in prestigious journals and conferences.
Previously, I have worked at various international organizations such as Hemolens Diagnostics, Tooploox, University Hospital Mannheim, Volume Graphics, Tietoevry, IMEC, Neurosoft, and the European Space Agency, enriching my experience and expanding my network within the AI and technology landscape.

title: Tomasz Konopczynski

content: We developed a real-time semantic segmentation models for identifying humans in video streams across web, Windows, and macOS. Designed a comprehensive library, abstracting complex tasks such as pre and post-processing and multithreading, allowing seamless client integration. This impactful project significantly enhanced the efficiency and ease of deploying advanced segmentation capabilities in diverse applications, without clients navigating the technical depths.
summary: A real-time semantic segmentation models for identifying humans in video streams.
title: Realtime Semantic Segmentation

content: Developed a generative AI model capable of producing data from textual input, incorporating segmentation masks to eliminate the need for subsequent annotation. This innovation not only curtails costs but also ensures the generation of richer and more diverse training data for enhanced model performance.
summary: Developed a generative AI model capable of producing data from textual input
title: Image generation with Large Langugage Models

content: We have an extensive backround in medical image processing, especially in 3D volumes of MRI and CT. Our works included models development capable of efficiently operating on high-volume 3D data, ensuring precise and reliable segmentation, localization, classification and simulation outcomes.
summary: We have an extensive backround in medical image processing.
title: Medical Image Processing

content: We worked on an autonomous delivery robot project, focusing on real-time semantic segmentation for autonomous driving on edge devices. Our model adeptly handled a range of environmental challenges, including varying weather conditions and day-to-night transitions, ensuring robust and reliable robot navigation.
title: Semantic segmentation for autonomous vehicles

content: The development of a teleoperation library for autonomous vehicles, ensuring efficient data streaming and enhanced remote control. This advancement played a role the safety aspects of autonomous vehicle operation.
title: Teleoperation for autonomus vehicles

content: A parcel detection and tracking system, tailored for efficient parcel management in expansive warehouses. The project entailed training robust models and crafting an efficient library to ensure real-time functionality within high-resolution camera networks.
title: Parcel recognition system in warehouses

content: We introduced the Plugin Networks, an innovation enhancing model flexibility. These auxiliary networks, attached to original models, enable the alteration of model behavior without the necessity of retraining the foundational structure. While our focus was predominantly on discriminative models, the versatile application also extends to generative models, showcasing its broad utility. We used a simialr idea in our Image Generation project.
title: Plugin Networks (Research)

content: We developed a food recognition model for intelligent ovens, I successfully designed a system capable of distinguishing among 100+ food classes. Prioritizing both compute and memory efficiency, the model was optimized for local deployment on edge devices, ensuring swift and accurate in-device food identification.
summary: We developed a food recognition model for intelligent ovens.
title: Food recognition for intelligent oven

content: An action recognition system tailored for monitoring senior individuals in nursing homes. The model was adept at observing the well-being of residents, especially those with dementia and Alzheimer’s disease, by proficiently detecting routine actions, such as breakfast preparation, ensuring consistent care and early anomaly detection.
summary: An action recognition system tailored for monitoring senior individuals in nursing homes.
title: Patient monitoring - action recognition

content: This project was aimed at enhancing recovery processes in neurotherapy. We developed a model for pose detection and segmentation, which played a crucial role in monitoring exercises and tracking patients’ progress, ensuring more personalized and effective recovery pathways.
title: Pose estimation and segmentation for neuro-therapy

content: Contributed to a people re-identification project designed for theme parks, aiming to gauge the rate of queue progression. In the face of challenges like overlapping and occlusion in crowded scenarios, the system effectively distinguished individual identities. This methodology was subsequently patented.
summary: People re-identification project designed for theme park
title: People ReIdentification in crowded scenes

content: We paricipated in the calibration of the SPIRE Fourier-Transform Spectrometer on the HERSCHEL space observatory, focusing on ensuring its accurate and reliable operation for space observations.
title: Spectrometre calibration
